dataSetInformation.common:synonyms: Ni-rich LiNi1-x-yMxCoyO2; NMC; Ni-rich layered transition metal oxides
dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: Ni-rich LiNi1-x-yMxCoyO2 (NMC: 1-x-y ≥ 0.6) are promising cathode materials for lithium-ion batteries due to their high reversible capacity and low cost. However, the fast capacity decay and voltage fading caused by interphasial instability require improvement. The unstable cathode-electrolyte interphase (CEI) and transition metal dissolution at higher voltages can lead to capacity decay and voltage fading. Ni-rich layered transition metal oxides (NMC) have been identified as the primary cathode candidate for powering next-generation electric vehicles and were extensively studied in the last two decades. The Ni-rich LiNi1-x-yMnxCoyO2 (NMC) layered oxides have been promising materials to replace the LiCoO2 commercial cathode due to their high operation voltages, low cost, and enhanced capacity. However, structural instability is the main drawback of the Ni-rich NMC system, leading to capacity fading, which prevents its commerce application.

富镍 LiNi1-x-yMxCoyO2（NMC：1-x-y ≥ 0.6）具有高可逆容量和低成本的特点，是很有前途的锂离子电池正极材料。然而，相间不稳定性导致的容量快速衰减和电压衰减问题亟待改进。不稳定的阴极-电解质相间（CEI）和过渡金属在较高电压下的溶解会导致容量衰减和电压衰减。富镍层状过渡金属氧化物（NMC）已被确定为下一代电动汽车的主要阴极候选材料，并在过去二十年中得到了广泛研究。富含镍的 LiNi1-x-yMnxCoyO2（NMC）层状氧化物具有工作电压高、成本低和容量大等优点，是替代钴酸锂商用阴极的理想材料。然而，富镍 NMC 系统的主要缺点是结构不稳定，会导致容量衰减，这阻碍了其商业应用。
